intro: Rhodanthe manglesii var. alba, commonly known as the white manglesii rhodanthe, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It belongs to the daisy family, Asteraceae, and is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal regions and is adapted to sandy soils and salty air. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, while its stems are erect and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. This variety is prized for its ornamental value and is often cultivated in gardens for its delicate appearance.
